etymologies: mid 19th century: from Spanish, via Latin from Greek siros ‘corn pit’

definitions: a tower or pit on a farm used to store grain.
shortDefinitions: tall tower or pit on farm used to store grain

definitions: a pit or other airtight structure in which green crops are compressed and stored as silage.
shortDefinitions: pit or other airtight structure in which green crops are compressed and stored as silage

definitions: an underground chamber in which a guided missile is kept ready for firing.
shortDefinitions: underground chamber in which guided missile is kept ready for firing

definitions: a system, process, department, etc. that operates in isolation from others

examples.text: it's vital that team members step out of their silos and start working together
we have made significant strides in breaking down that silo mentality

shortDefinitions: system, process, department, etc. that operates in isolation from others

definitions: isolate (one system, process, department, etc.) from others

examples.text: most companies have expensive IT systems they have developed over the years, but they are siloed
why are so many companies still siloing their SEO and social media marketing?

shortDefinitions: isolate one system, process, etc. from others
